thread.title: Prep Roundup: Mount Paran beats Walker for Area 5A championship
thread.title_full: Prep Roundup: Mount Paran beats Walker for Area 5A championship

author: MDJ staff reports (noreply@mdjonline.com)
title: Prep Roundup: Mount Paran beats Walker for Area 5A championship
text: Prep Roundup: Mount Paran beats Walker for Area 5A championship by MDJ staff reports The Marietta Daily Journal October 09, 2015 12:22 AM | 32 views | 0 | 0 | | One year after losing the Area 5A championship to Walker, the Mount Paran Christian volleyball team got its revenge Thursday.The Lady Eagles swept to victory in straight sets, winning 25-17, 25-12, 25-15. In last season’s championship, Mount Paran had a 2-1 lead on Walker in sets, only to lose to a Lady Wolverine rally.Scoring runs were the key for the Lady Eagles (21-13), with Caitlyn Tucker starting the second set on an 11-point service run.Three players had double-doubles for Mount Paran, with Jillian Tucker falling just short of a triple-double following 36 assists, 16 digs and eight kills.Sarah-Hayes Farley added 16 kills and 12 digs, while Sarah Ramstack had 13 kills and 25 digs. Ashley Cook finished with nine digs and four kills.Mount Paran and Walker will each host first-round state playoff matches Thursday, with their respective matches against the fourth and third seeds of Area 6A.► Hillgrove 2, Kennesaw Mountain 0: The fourth-seeded Lady Hawks moved one step closer to the state playoffs after winning 25-14, 25-19 in a first-round Region 4 tournament match at Marietta.Hillgrove (21-15) will face either Marietta or North Paulding in Saturday morning’s quarterfinal, with the winner clinching a playoff berth.Kennesaw Mountain (22-19), which beat Osborne 25-8, 25-9 earlier in the day, will play a losers’ bracket match Saturday for the chance to get back into the race for a playoff berth.Janna Jernigan and Quinn Dunlap each had seven kills for Hillgrove, with Jernigan also totaling four aces. Brittany Tullier had six kills and two blocks, while Allison Purdie had 26 assists and two blocks. Myah Martin had 22 digs.Meghan Zobelli led Kennesaw Mountain with a combined 12 kills, 10 digs and four aces in the two matches, while Leah Spurgeon had 24 assists and three aces.► Allatoona advances in area tourney: Allatoona beat East Paulding (25-4, 25-8) and Chapel Hill (25-17, 25-16) to advance to the winners’ bracket championship of the Area 5 tournament. Jada Armstrong played a prominent role after missing most of the season with an ankle injury and led the Lady Buccaneers with 16 kills on the night. Katie Cory finished with six aces and 26 digs, and Mikayla Morris added five aces. Meara Simmons had 43 assists, and Jedaiah Daniels finished with 15 kills and added four blocks.Allatoona (30-17) will play Hiram on Saturday for a spot in the area championship.► Dominion Christian 3, Holy Spirit 0: Hailey Giles and Onnie Robbins each had five kills as the Lady Knights won 25-14, 29-27, 25-18.Giles also had 14 digs, while Robbins had six digs and two blocks.Lucy Niveason had 17 assists and four kills, with Carolan Dockery adding 15 digs.SOFTBALL► South Cobb finishes as region runner-up: The Lady Eagles scored three runs in the fourth inning and two more in the fifth to beat Newnan 6-0 and advance to advance to the Region 3 championship.South Cobb went on to fall 10-2 to East Coweta in the final. Kiera Dudley was 4-for-4 against Newnan with a home run, triple and three RBIs. Terilyn Harris was 3-for-3 with two RBIs, while Dezirae Rhodes was 1-for-3 with a double. East Coweta managed 10 hits against South Cobb in the championship and scored five runs in the fourth inning to pull away. ► Walker 19, King’s Ridge Christian 6 (5 inn.): The Lady Wolverines’ fate will be up to the power ratings after a commanding win in their regular-season finale.Walker (12-14, 11-9 Region 6A) was seeded 19th in the most recent Class A private-school power ratings and will need to finish in the top 16 to be considered for a state playoff berth.Nicole Simon batted 3-for-4 with a home run and four RBIs, while Sarabeth McClure was 2-for-4 with three RBIs. McClure was also one of three pitchers Walker used.Ashley Cranfill was 2-for-4 with two RBIs, and Madeline Daniel was 2-for-2.► Mount Zion-Carroll 14, North Cobb Christian 0 (4 inn.): Moriah Hidden had the lone hit for the Lady Eagles in the Region 6A loss.North Cobb Christian (5-13, 5-13) will close the season today, traveling to Excel Christian for a region doubleheader with Trion.Late Wednesday► Harrison 9, North Cobb 1 (5 inn.): Harrison scored eight runs over the final three innings to win a losers’ bracket game in the Region 4 tournament.The Lady Hoyas had 12 hits, scoring two in the third inning, four in the fourth and two in the fifth.Jaiden Fields batted 2-for-3 with three RBIs, including a double and a two-run home run. Gabby Malafronte went 3-for-3 with an RBI and three runs scored, while Lindley Bruce was 3-for-3 with a double and scored twice.Emily Kachel gave up one earned run on four hits and struck out seven in four innings to earn the victory.McKenzie Krause hit a solo home run in the second for North Cobb.► Harrison 6, Kennesaw Mountain 1: After falling behind 1-0 through the first inning, Harrison scored six unanswered to take the win in a losers’ bracket game of the Region 4 tournament.Jaiden Fields had a hit, two RBIs and stole a base for Harrison, which totaled 11 hits. She also walked and was hit by a pitch. Mikenzie Vaughn went 3-for-4 with a double and two RBIs, while Summer Swanson had a hit and an RBI.Michy Ramos had an RBI single for Kennesaw Mountain.
